User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account in the system.

role.description: The user's role in the system.

joinedAt.description: The timestamp when the user created their account.

Fan.title: Fan
Fan.description: Represents a fan's activity and engagement metrics.

joinDate.description: The timestamp when the fan created their account.

onlineStatus.description: Indicates if the fan is currently online.

lastActive.description: The timestamp of the fan's last activity.

likes.description: Total number of items the fan has liked.

comments.description: Total number of comments the fan has posted.

shares.description: Total number of items the fan has shared.

contributions.description: Total monetary value of contributions made by the fan.

referrals.description: Total number of successful referrals made by the fan.

Contribution.title: Contribution
Contribution.description: Represents a single monetary contribution from a fan.

fanId.description: The ID of the fan who made the contribution.

amount.description: The monetary amount of the contribution.

method.description: The payment method used for the contribution (e.g., 'PayPal', 'M-Pesa').

paymentMethod.description: The ID of the payment method document from the /paymentMethods collection.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the contribution was made.

status.description: The status of the contribution payment.

Comment.title: Comment
Comment.description: Represents a comment made by a fan on a piece of content, with engagement features.

fanId.description: The ID of the fan who posted the comment.

commentDate.description: The timestamp when the comment was posted.

likes.description: A list of user UIDs who have liked the comment.

reactions.description: A map of emojis to a list of user UIDs who reacted with that emoji.

replies.description: A list of replies to this comment.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a message sent via the contact form, with engagement features.

lastRepliedAt.description: Timestamp of the last reply to keep conversations sorted.

fanId.description: The UID of the fan who sent the message, if they were logged in.

likes.description: A list of user UIDs who have liked the message.

reactions.description: A map of emojis to a list of user UIDs who reacted with that emoji.

replies.description: A list of replies to this message from admins or the fan.

Admin.title: Admin
Admin.description: Represents an administrator with a specific role.

Like.title: Like
Like.description: Represents a like on a piece of content.

fanId.description: The ID of the fan who liked the content.

likeDate.description: The timestamp when the content was liked.

PaymentMethod.title: Payment Method
PaymentMethod.description: Represents a single method for fans to contribute.

name.description: The display name of the payment method (e.g., 'M-Pesa').

currencies.description: A list of supported currency codes (e.g., ['KES', 'USD']).

active.description: Controls whether the payment method is visible to users.

providerId.description: A unique identifier for the payment provider (e.g. 'mpesa', 'paypal').

firestore.reasoning: The data model is structured to separate user authentication and profile data from engagement-specific data. The `/users` collection holds core, user-specific information including their role, secured by UID. The `/fans` collection tracks engagement metrics, also keyed by UID, allowing for a clear separation of concerns. The `/admins` collection stores roles for administrators, with write access restricted to super-admins for security. The `/messages` collection stores contact form submissions and is enhanced with engagement data like likes, reactions, and now replies with timestamps. Global collections like `/contributions` and subcollections like `/music/{musicId}/comments` and `/music/{musicId}/likes` are used for simplified querying and management. The new `/paymentMethods` collection allows admins to dynamically control the information displayed on the support page from the dashboard.
